channel.title: Need help please?
channel.description: Ok, i have my own website with my own purchased domain. awesomepk.com , I want to add a Register/Login button on my website so it can make an account on the server. If they are not registered it wont let them play. If they are It will let them play. How would I be able to do this? Please help me! Thanks for your time.

item.title: Need help please?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“montalvom, post:11, topic:157260”]…
little note i know how to use dream weaver thats how i made my site[/quote]

Too bad you can’t spell DreamWeaver. Like it’s that big of a deal, “Ooh I know how to use a widely-used and well understood program.” If you’re looking for a pat on the back for every little thing you do. This isn’t nescessarily the right place for you.

To do what you’re asking you would need a pretty good knowledge of MySql, and you would have to have to know how to write to text files, and get values from those text files; for them to be used in the Server. If you’re just wanting to secure your applet all you would have to do is make a Register/Login System, have 1 MySQL table, and just have a “<?php require("[b]Login system page here[/b].php"); ?>” at the top before the tag. but to do something simple like I just said, you would need to have knowledge of PHP, or read up on Log in system tutorials.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help please?
item.dc:creator: @montalvom montalvom
item.description:
@montalvom wrote:

Register button application

[code]

Zachera's Game
Registration 
		</td>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">Username:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="user" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">Password:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="password" name="pass" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">MSN:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="msn" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">AIM:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="aim" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">Yahoo IM:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="yahoo" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">Skype:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="skype" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<div align="right">E-mail:</div>
		</td>
		<td>
			<center><input type="text" name="email" maxlength="30"></center>
		</td>

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td colspan="2" align="right">
			<input type="hidden" name="id">
			<input type="hidden" name="attemptid">
			<input type="submit" name="subjoin" value="Register">
		</td>
	</tr>
</table>
[/code]

little note i know how to use dream weaver thats how i made my site

item.title: Need help please?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

montalvom:

its not for a client. Do you know how real runescape is? you need to register to play? well yea thats what i want for mines…

Like I said, the amount of effort that would take to get this working from scratch is completely not worth it. Have you tried ripping a registration script/code from anywhere yet?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help please?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

OK, time for your new word of the day. MySQL. If your server doesn’t have it, either convert it, or download ReenScape Shift. Then set up your site to make the appropriate SQL queries to insert a new user row into your database. This isn’t something you can copy and paste, you’ll actually have to learn to do something.

Read full topic
